result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael A DeNamur was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs of the action. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Submit DNA sample. Defendant has agreed to 7 month joint recommendation on revocation files.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael A DeNamur

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Michael A DeNamur in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer. Defendant Michael A DeNamur in custody. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charge, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest plea. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty. Court questions Defendant, who agrees with repeater status. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Bond no longer in effect.

Defendant Michael A DeNamur in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer. Defendant Michael A DeNamur in custody. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions Defendant on Shawano County case. Defendant advises that revocation has been recommended. Defense has been appointed on revocation case as well, has offer that covers both cases. Defense has to work out revocation matter, questions resolution of cases together. Court cannot handle Shawano County case. State advises of offer. Revocation hearing is set for Sept. 10. Bond continues as is.  Status conference scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defense was just appointed, was not here for bond hearing, advises that Defendant will miss job interview this week, presents argument for reduction of bond. State will need time to review prior record to determine if Defendant has missed court appearances. Court questions Defendant, who is on probation through Shawano. Court wants to see what probation status is, advises Defense can file motion.

Defendant Michael A DeNamur in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer. Defendant Michael A DeNamur in custody. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge, max. penalties, right to counsel. Defense enters not guilty pleas.  Status conference scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 10:30 am.
No contact direct or indirect with GL, her mother or their residence. To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving Justice Center.

Defendant Michael A DeNamur appeared by video conference. Attorney Gregory A. Gerbers appeared by phone. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return 7/13/15, 10:00.
